title.narrative: 3.1 HEA-ADOLESCENTS AGENTS OF CHANGE

description.narrative: 103/001 By 2020, the Government and stakeholders in the health sector, at national and subnational level, have increased capacity to expand and deliver a package of quality services for adolescent boys and girls, aged 10 to under 18, in emergency and non- emergency situations, and urban settings., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3. By 2020, adolescent girls and boys in Bangladesh, especially the most disadvantaged, access and utilize high-quality basic social services in a safe and protected environment, and are resilient and empowered as active agents of change.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 103/001 By 2020, the Government and stakeholders in the health sector, at national and subnational level, have increased capacityto expand and deliver a package of quality services for adolescent boys and girls, aged 10 to under 18, in emergency and non-emergency situations, and urban settings.

description.narrative: Adolescent-friendly health services were scaled to 1,240 health facilities in 2021 despite the COVID-19 related barriers. Service providers from COVID-impacted districts;received training on basic adolescent health services. Psychosocial services were integrated with the health platform and a website and app;developed, reaching;3,169,367;visitors with information on sexual and reproductive health and rights, gender-based violence, mental health and nutrition.;;UNICEF supported partners to develop capacity on psycho-social and psychosexual counselling for the adolescent key population.;;Access to sexual reproductive health services including HIV testing was enhanced.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2021

title.narrative: Number and proportion of health facilities delivering adolescent friendly services in UNICEF priority districts(49461), Text
